summary:
• Talks between Afghan government representatives and the Taliban have begun.
• The talks will exclude female participants due to Taliban restrictions.
• The negotiations aim to find a peaceful solution to the conflict in Afghanistan.

• Over 30 passengers injured in severe turbulence on Air Europa flight.
• Flight diverted to Brazil due to safety concerns.
• Passengers receive medical attention upon arrival at Brazilian airport.

• Far-right candidates have withdrawn from the race to prevent them from winning.
• The far-right party has taken the lead after the first round of voting.
• Many people on the left believe they now have a chance to win due to the decline of centrist candidate Emmanuel Macron.

• Viktor Orban urges a ceasefire during his visit to Kyiv.
• Viktor Orban visits Ukraine and proposes a ceasefire.
• Hungary opposes European Union policies and supports far-right ideology.

• Over 100 people were killed in a stampede during an Indian religious event.
• The incident occurred due to overcrowding and lack of crowd control measures.
• Authorities have launched an investigation into the cause of the tragedy.

• Iran is set to hold its presidential election.
• The country's Supreme Leader will appoint the next president from the top four candidates who receive the most votes.
• This election marks a significant milestone in Iranian politics as it determines the direction of the country's future governance.

• Three people were killed in road accidents in Ireland.
• Famous Irish celebrities visited the town of Muff.
• A woman and her child were among those who died.

1. Israel's conscription rule sparks outrage among ultra-Orthodox Jews.
2. A former Netanyahu supporter turns against him after her son is taken hostage by Hamas.

• A violent gang fight in Mexico resulted in multiple deaths.
• The incident occurred between rival gangs, leaving behind a large number of casualties.
• Authorities are investigating the motive behind the brutal conflict.

• The Dutch government has been sworn in
• This follows an election win by Wilders 
• The new government is led by Wilders

• New Zealand's shift towards conservatism is affecting its political landscape.
• The country was previously seen as a safe haven for those fleeing the US under Donald Trump's presidency.
• However, recent developments suggest that this perception is no longer accurate.

• US funds deportation efforts in Panama amid migrant crackdown.
• Deportation funding is part of an ongoing campaign to reduce migration numbers.
• The expanded migrant crackdown targets people crossing borders without proper documentation.

• Sierra Leone has banned child marriage.
• This move aims to protect children from early marriage.
• The ban is expected to improve education outcomes for girls.

• Taiwan is studying Ukraine's experiences to better prepare itself for potential military conflicts.
• This includes analyzing Ukraine's defense strategies and tactics.
• The lessons learned may help Taiwan improve its own national security capabilities.

• The UK general election campaign is highlighting concerns over dental healthcare.
• DIY dentistry could become a bigger issue due to its potential impact on public health.
• Voters may prioritize oral care in their decision-making process during the election.

• The sentencing of former President Trump in his hush-money case has been delayed until September.
• Former Mayor Rudy Giuliani has been disbarred due to making false statements about the 2020 election.
• A stingray that was found pregnant but did not have a mate has died.
• The US paid $176 million to Moderna to help develop a vaccine against the bird flu virus.
• Former Vice President Joe Biden believes he performed poorly during a recent debate because he had jet lag and was traveling at the time.
• The Supreme Court ruled that former President Trump does not have complete immunity while serving as president.
• Some doctors initially dismissed certain women's symptoms as hysteria, but now the women are speaking out against them.
